en.pressContinue: Press the next button to continue.
en.thanksCatalyst: Thank You to the team at Catalyst Games for all your hard work!
en.hint1: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> Try letting go of the launch button to see how gravity effects your spaceship.
en.hint2: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> Tap the buttons rather than hold them to get more precise movement.
en.hint3: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> Let go of the launch button when rotating to increase the forces exerted on the spaceship to turn.
en.hint4: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> Using all your thrusters at the same time will deplete your fuel faster. no fuel means no more force!
en.hint5: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> When there is no gravity being exerted on your spaceship, even small movements can have large effects. plan accordingly
en.hint6: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> Use a feathering technique to make more accurate turns and keep your speed down while in space environments.
en.hint7: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> If the force of the asteroid is equal to the force of the spaceship then the spaceship will not take damage when it collides.
en.hint8: <color=#FFDD00>Hint:</color> Avoid objects with larger mass as they will exponentially require more force to divert or stop the bigger they are!
en.checkProgress:
Hold up! 
 You have saved progress! 
<color=#FF0000>If you continue, you will lose your progress!</color> 
Would you like to continue?
en.objective1: <color=#DD00FF>Objective: Collect the rocket token and return back to the launch pad.</color>
en.Level1Line1: Welcome to the space program Cadet! I will be your Instructor before you get into orbit!
en.Level1Line2: Every space cadet needs to start on the basics before they get their <color=#00FFFF>Space Wings!</color> That's what I'm here to teach you!
en.Level1Line3: It's super important for astronauts to know their physics! How's your <color=#FFDD00>Newton's Third law of Motion?</color>
en.Level1Line4: Let's start with the basics. <color=#FFDD00>Newton's Third Law of Motion refers to the principle that every action has an equal and opposite reaction.</color>
en.Level1Line5: In other words, <color=#FFDD00>for every force exerted on an object, there is an equal and opposite force exerted back on the object. </color>
en.Level1Line6: Let's see an example of this in action! <color=#DD00FF>Use the LAUNCH button to try and collect the token and land safely back on the landing pad! </color>
en.WinScreen1: Well done Cadet! you are well on your way to getting those <color=#00FFFF>Space Wings!</color>
en.objective2: <color=#DD00FF>Objective: Collect all three coins and land on the landing pad</color>
en.Level2Line1: Well done Cadet! you are well on your way to getting those <color=#00FFFF>Space Wings!</color>
en.Level2Line2: This lesson is all about <color=#DD00FF>maneuvering.</color> I'll teach you how to move your spaceship around not just go up and down!
en.Level2Line3: <color=#FFDD00>Did you know that just like the force exerted to launch us into the air, a similar force can be applied to the side of your spaceship to make it turn? </color>
en.Level2Line4: Use your <color=#DD00FF>Side Thrusters</color> to turn the spaceship in mid-air and land on the landing pad over to the right.
en.Level2Line5: As you can see your <color=#DD00FF>Locator</color> will show you where the Landing Pad is.
en.Level2Line6: <color=#DD00FF>Oh, and if you collect all 3 coins I'll give you</color> <color=#FFDD00>3 stars</color> <color=#DD00FF>for completing this mission! </color>
en.objective3: <color=#DD00FF>Objective: Collect all three coins and land on the landing pad</color>
en.Level3Line1: Great work Cadet! Your instructor has told me a lot about your progress!
en.Level3Line2: If you keep going the way you are going you will be one of our top pilots in no time!
en.Level3Line3: Now, i know its a lot of fun to pilot your spaceship but you need to keep a watchful eye on your <color=#DD00FF>gas...</color>
en.Level3Line4: <color=#FFDD00>Did you know that Newton's Third Law also applies to the fuel used in spacecraft? When fuel is burned, gases are expelled backward, creating a force that propels the spacecraft forward. It's like a controlled explosion!</color>
en.Level3Line5: If you run out of <color=#DD00FF>gas</color> then you wont be able to use your thrusters. <color=#FFDD00>No propulsion force means no opposing force, you won't be able to control your ship!</color>
en.Level3Line6: <color=#DD00FF>Try to collect the coins and land on the Landing Pad without running out of gas!</color>
en.objective4: <color=#DD00FF>Objective: Collect all six coins and return to the launch pad</color>
en.Level4Line1: It looks like the Cadet Instructor has taught you well! I think you might just be ready to get your <color=#00FFFF>Space Wings!</color>
en.Level4Line2: <color=#FFDD00>Understanding Newton's Third Law helps spacecraft pilots make precise maneuvers by considering the equal and opposite forces involved.
en.Level4Line3: Pilots can calculate how their actions will affect the movement of the spacecraft and plan accordingly.</color>
en.Level4Line4: For your last planet-based exercise <color=#DD00FF>try to collect as many coins as you can and land safely back on the landing pad.</color>
en.Level4Line5: If you can get this exercise right then we can start your proper missions in space!
en.objective5: <color=#DD00FF>Rescue the floating astronaut and find the landing pad.</color>
en.Level5Line1: Congratulations Cadet! You've successfully graduated and received your <color=#00FFFF>Space Wings!</color>
en.Level5Line2: <color=#FFDD00>Did you know astronauts have to wear special suits during spacewalks because of Newton's Third Law? </color>
en.Level5Line3: <color=#FFDD00>When they use their hands or legs to push off objects in space, the force can push them away too. The suits have small jets that help them control their movements.</color>
en.Level5Line4: For your first space mission <color=#DD00FF>we need you to rescue our Communications Officer.</color>
en.Level5Line5: They didn't study up on <color=#FFDD00>Newton's Third Law of Motion</color> and now they are floating around somewhere in space!
en.Level5Line6: Remember that your <color=#DD00FF>locator</color> can help you find your objectives.
en.objective6: <color=#DD00FF>Rescue the floating astronauts and find the landing pad.</color>
en.Level6Line1: Thanks so much for saving me! I could have been floating around forever!
en.Level6Line2: Since your last mission I've been brushing up on my <color=#FFDD00>Newton's Third Law of Motion. </color>
en.Level6Line3: <color=#FFDD00>According to Newton's Third Law, as I throw the balloon forward, I'll experience an equal and opposite reaction backward.</color>
en.Level6Line4: <color=#FFDD00>So, while the balloon zooms towards you, pushing you backward, I'll find myself drifting in the opposite direction, thanks to the force of the balloon pushing me backward.</color>
en.Level6Line5: <color=#FFDD00>It's like a cosmic game of catch! We'll both experience those equal and opposite reactions as we toss things around in space.</color>
en.Level6Line6: Remember, even something as simple as throwing a balloon can have fascinating consequences in zero gravity, all because of <color=#FFDD00>Newton's Third Law!</color>
en.Level6Line7: So, next time we're floating in space together, let's have a balloon-throwing competition and see who can maneuver the most gracefully! Sound like fun?
en.objective7: <color=#DD00FF>Rescue the astronauts while avoiding the asteroids</color>
en.Level7Line1: Hey there! I'm a Cadet just like you! I'm so happy I spent time learning <color=#FFDD00>Newton's Third Law of Motion. </color> So I could become a space pilot!
en.Level7Line2: Did you notice there's a bunch of <color=#FF0000>asteroids</color> floating around up here?
en.Level7Line3: <color=#FFDD00>You know, even those giant space rocks, follow Newton's Third Law, just like we do in our spaceships?</color>
en.Level7Line4: <color=#FFDD00>When an</color> <color=#FF0000>asteroid</color> <color=#FFDD00>is moving through space it is pulled by the gravity of the surrounding planets and guess what? The</color> <color=#FF0000>asteroid</color> <color=#FFDD00>pulls the planet too!</color>
en.Level7Line5: <color=#FFDD00>It's a cosmic dance between planets, space rocks and debris all following Newton's rules of action and reaction.</color>
en.Level7Line6: <color=#DD00FF>Try to rescue those astronauts without running into an</color> <color=#FF0000>asteroid!</color>
en.objective8: <color=#DD00FF>Rescue the astronauts while avoiding the asteroids</color>
en.Level8Line1: Congratulations Cadet you are an important member of our fleet!
en.Level8Line2: For your final test, I'd like you to rescue all of the astronauts as quickly as you can!
en.Level8Line3: <color=#FFDD00>Remember, in space, the smallest amount of force can carry you pretty far!</color>
en.Level8Line4: <color=#FFDD00>make sure to avoid the </color><color=#FF0000>asteroids</color><color=#FFDD00> or use your thrusters to reduce your speed to bounce off them!</color> Good luck Cadet! we are counting on you.
en.ExitScreen: Congratulations! You are now a Jet Master! You can finish the game here or go back to the level select screen and attempt your favourite levels again!

es.thanksCatalyst: Thank You to the team at Catalyst Games for all your hard work!

jp.readyToPlay: あなたは遊ぶ準備ができていますか？
jp.pressContinue: 続行するには '次へ'ボタンを押してください。
